newsitem.title: FRANCE: Blast hits Paris subway station, one dead, 28 hurt.
newsitem.headline: Blast hits Paris subway station, one dead, 28 hurt.

text.p: One person died and 28 were injured, eight of them seriously, when a blast rocked a station of the regional express underground railway in central Paris on Tuesday, the fire brigade said.
The explosion occurred just before 6.30 p.m. (1730 GMT) at the Port Royal RER station on the Left Bank.
The blast took place in a carriage of the RER train.

"We heard a strong blast," one witness who was in a bus above the station told France-Info radio. "There was a column of black smoke which enveloped the bus. There was a strong smell of powder, like at a shooting range," she said.
Justice sources said anti-terrorism investigators had been called to the scene.

The explosion occurred on the same line, and two stations away from Saint-Michel station where a blast in July last year killed eight people and injured nearly 100, launching a wave of attacks across France by Algerian Moslem fundamentalists.
